headline: S&P 500, Nasdaq Back on Record Track
summary: Stocks are rising on a benign inflation report, with the S&P 500 readying for its 16th record close for the year and the 19th for the Nasdaq.  The Dow has gained 442 points, or more than 1%, and after a brief move lower both the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite are now rising again, up 0.5% each and on pace to clinch new records at the close.  Fueling the Nasdaq are chip stocks.

headline: Norway’s $1.9 Trillion Fund Has Best Quarter Since 2023
summary: Equities drove the results for the $1.9 trillion fund, at 8.45%, with unlisted infrastructure investments generating 8.1%, Norges Bank Investment Management said in a report on Tuesday.  The world’s largest wealth fund owns about 1.5% of listed stocks globally.  More than two thirds of the fund is in equities, all outside of Norway.
